executor_description: This endpoint is to be called to authenticate 3DS Secure Transactions

queryParams.description: Unique reference generated for the transaction by Monnify
"API_NOTIFICATION" only enabled merchants can access resource
Object containing card information
Card number
Card expiration month
Card expiration year
Card pin from card owner
Security code behind card
Token id from the request response (otpData.id)
OTP from card owner (use 12345 for test card)

executor_description: This endpoint allows you get short USSD codes for a transaction using the transactionReference of an initialized transaction and the bank code of the customer’s bank from the get banks endpoint. This is useful if you want to control the payment interface. There are a lot of UX considerations to keep in mind if you choose to do this so we recommend you read this

queryParams.description: Unique reference generated for the transaction by Monnify.
Bank code of the desired bank from which payment would be made.
The amount to be paid by the customer.
The generated code for that bank.
The reference of the provider of the ussd code.
The ussd string the user is to dial on this device for payment.

executor_description: This endpoint is to be called whenever an OTP is to be authorized.

queryParams.description: Unique reference generated for the transaction by Monnify
"API_NOTIFICATION" only enabled merchants can access resource
Object containing card information
Card number
Card expiration month
Card expiration year
Card pin from card owner
Security code behind card
Token id from the request response (otpData.id)
OTP from card owner (use 12345 for test card)

executor_description: Monnify allows you to charge your customers who make one-time payments through the use of their cards. To charge a card you will need to make a request to the endpoint below:

queryParams.description: Unique reference generated for the transaction by Monnify
"API_NOTIFICATION" only enabled merchants can access resource
Object containing card information
Card number
Card expiration month
Card expiration year
Card pin from card owner
Security code behind card
Token id from the request response (otpData.id)
OTP from card owner (use 12345 for test card)

deviceInformation.userAgentBrowserValue: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko)     Chrome/105.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

executor_description: This endpoint allows you get virtual account details for a transaction using the transactionReference of an initialized transaction. This is useful if you want to control the payment interface. There are a lot of UX considerations to keep in mind if you choose to do this so we recommend you read this.

queryParams.description: The amount to be paid by the customer
The currency of the transaction being initialized. "NGN"
Merchant's Unique reference for the transaction.
Unique reference generated for the transaction by Monnify.
Description for the transaction. Will be returned as part of the account name on name enquiry for transfer payments. This will be prefixed with the merchants name.
Full name of the customer
Email address of the customer
Merchant's contract code (Can be found on the Monnify dashboard)
A URL which can be used to display the Monnify payment interface where the customer can then pay for the transaction via bank transfer or card.
Array of payment methods enabled for the merchant
Object containing specifications on how payments to this reserve account should be split.
The unique reference for the sub account that should receive the split.
Boolean to determine if the sub account should bear transaction fees or not
The percentage of the transaction fee to be borne by the sub account
The percentage of the amount paid to be split into the sub account.
Name of the merchant
Virtual Account number generated for that transaction. This is the account number the customer should transfer to when he wants to pay.
Name to be displayed during name enquiry. This will be prefixed with the merchants name.
Name of the bank where the virtual account was generated
Bank code of the bank where the virtual account was generated
Number of seconds left till the account expires
USSD string the customer can dial to make payment from his bank. Only returned when a bank code is specified will be null otherwise.
Time the request was made
Transaction fee to be charged by Monnify
Total amount to be paid by the customer. Will include fees if customer is to bear charges otherwise it will be the same as the amount

executor_description: This endpoint allows you to initialize a transaction on Monnify and it returns a checkout URL which you can load within a browser to display the payment form to your customer. The checkout URL has an expiry time of 40 minutes.

queryParams.description: A URL which can be used to display the Monnify payment interface where the customer can then pay for the transaction via bank transfer or card.
Array of payment methods enabled for the merchant. If not specified, the default payment methods enabled in the contract detail will apply.
Object containing specifications on how payments to this reserve account should be split.
The unique reference for the sub account that should receive the split.
Boolean to determine if the sub account should bear transaction fees or not
The percentage of the amount paid to be split into the sub account.
Name of the merchant
A URL which user will be redirected to, on completion of the payment.
The amount to be paid by the customer
The currency of the transaction being initialized. "NGN"
Merchant's Unique reference for the transaction.
Unique reference generated for the transaction by Monnify.
Description for the transaction. Will be returned as part of the account name on name enquiry for transfer payments.
Full name of the customer
Email address of the customer
Merchant's contract code (Can be found on the Monnify dashboard)

executor_description: This endpoint deletes a merchant’s sub-account

pathParams.description: Add the sub-account code as a URL parameter and send a DELETE request to the endpoint above.

executor_description: This endpoint returns a list of sub-accounts previously created by the merchant.

queryParams.description: Settlement currency. "NGN"
The account number that should be created as a sub account.
The name attached to the account number
Name of the bank where the account is domiciled
The 3 digit bank code of the bank where the account number is domiciled
The email tied to the sub account. This email will receive settlement reports for settlements into the sub account.
The default percentage to be split into the sub account on any transaction. (Only applies if a specific amount is not passed during transaction initialization)
The unique reference for the sub account

executor_description: This endpoint creates a sub-account for a merchant, allowing the merchant split transaction settlement between the main account and one or more sub-account(s

queryParams.description: Settlement currency. "NGN"
The account number that should be created as a sub account.
The name attached to the account number
Name of the bank where the account is domiciled
The 3 digit bank code of the bank where the account number is domiciled
The email tied to the sub account. This email will receive settlement reports for settlements into the sub account.
The default percentage to be split into the sub account on any transaction. (Only applies if a specific amount is not passed during transaction initialization)
The unique reference for the sub account

Used to determine how Monnify should handle failed transaction validations in a batch. The two options are BREAK & CONTINUE. Use Break to tell Monnify to reject the entire batch and use CONTINUE to tell Monnify to process the valid transactions.

Used to determine how often Monnify should notify the merchant of progress when processing a batch transfer. The options are 10, 20, 50 and 100 and they represent percentages. i.e. 20 means notify me at intervals of 20% (20%, 40%, 60%, 80% ,100%).
The status  of a single transfer request. (SUCCESS, FAILED, PENDING, OTP_EMAIL_DISPATCH_FAILED, PENDING_AUTHORIZATION)
The status of the processing of the entire Batch. (FAILED_ON_ACCOUNTS_VALIDATION, OTP_EMAIL_DISPATCH_FAILED, PENDING, PENDING_AUTHORIZATION, AWAITING_PROCESSING, IN_PROGRESS ,COMPLETED)
The total number of transactions in the batch.

The total transaction fees deducted for all the transactions in the batch.

This endpoint allows you to get the available balance in your monnify wallet. Query param needed is the monnify wallet account numbe
This endpoint will help you resend OTP’s in scenarios where your customers don’t get the previous ones sent or in cases of expiration.
This API is to be used to update a customer's BVN mapped to a Reserved Account.

queryParams.description: Current BVN to be mapped to the reserved account. This bvn would be the default BVN for the allowed payment source.

executor_description: This endpoint updates the information on an existing Limit Profile for a merchant.

queryParams.description: The account reference of the reserved account to update
The name of the Limit Profile
The maximum amount that can be allowed per transaction on the reserved accounts.
The maximum number of transaction count per day allowed on the reserved accounts
The maximum amount per day in all transactions that can be allowed on the reserved accounts
This Limit Profile code is the unique identifier for the Limit Profile used to reference the Limit Profile

executor_description: To get the details of a customer's reservation with all account numbers reserved,  you can initiate a GET request to the endpoint below and we will return all the details attached to that account Reference.

pathParams.description: Your unique reference used to identify this reserved account

queryParams.description: Your unique reference used to identify this reserved account
The name you want to be attached to the reserved account. This will be displayed during name enquiry
Currency for transactions to this reserved account. Should be “NGN”
Contract Code (See your Monnify dashboard)
Contract Code (See your Monnify dashboard)
Full name of the customer who the account is being reserved for
BVN of the customer the account is being reserved for. Please note that if BVN is not supplied there will be low limits on the reserved account.
Object containing specifications on how payments to this reserve account should be split.
The unique reference for the sub account that should receive the split.
Boolean to determine if the sub account should bear transaction fees or not
The percentage of the transaction fee to be borne by the sub account
The percentage of the amount paid to be split into the sub account.
Name of the bank where the virtual account was created
Bank code of the bank where the virtual account was created
virtual account number generated for the accountReference (Reserved account number)
Status of the reserved account number ("ACTIVE" means the account can be used)
Date reserved account was created

executor_description: You can delete a reserved account by initiating a DELETE request to the endpoint below. Once the request is made, then the account will immediately be deallocated.

queryParams.description: Your unique reference used to identify this reserved account
The name you want to be attached to the reserved account. This will be displayed during name enquiry
Currency for transactions to this reserved account. Should be “NGN”
Contract Code (See your Monnify dashboard)

executor_description: This API enables you to restrict source accounts that can fund a reserved account using either BVNs or Account Name or Account Number. This is mandatory if restrictPaymentSource is set to true.

Email address of the customer

The virtual account number generated for the invoice. This is the account number the customer can transfer to, to pay this invoice
The name that will be displayed to the customer when he performs name enquiry on the virtual account. Please note there may be Prefixes
The name of the bank where the virtual account number was generated. The customer will be expected to select this bank when doing the bank transfer
The bank code of the bank where the virtual account number was generated

executor_description: Monnify allows you Reserve an Account for your customers who you send invoices to. You can then attach these accounts to invoices being generated so the customer always receives the same account number for any invoice he receives.   These accounts are slightly different from regular customer reserved accounts as customers cannot pay into these accounts until they are attached to an invoice. Basically, the account number is only active when attached to an invoice.

executor_description: We highly recommend that when you receive a notification from us, even after checking to ensure the hash values match, you should initiate a get transaction status request to us with the transactionReference to confirm the actual status of that transaction before updating the records on your database

executor_description: We highly recommend that when you receive a notification from us, even after checking to ensure the hash values match, you should initiate a get transaction status request to us with either the paymentReference or transactionReference to confirm the actual status of that transaction before updating the records on your database.

A timestamp value specifying the date to stop filtering disbursement transactions  by the createdAt field
A number specifying the lower bound for filtering the transactions by the amount field
A number specifying the upper bound for filtering the transactions by the amount field.

executor_description: This API can be used to get the status of an initiated refund.

pathParams.description: Your unique refund reference supplied in the initiate refund request

executor_description: This API enables you to process a refund to a customer for a transaction.

queryParams.description: An integer specifying page of transactions to be retrieved. Page number starts from 0.
An integer specifying size of transactions to be returned per page.
Timestamp to filter returned records. Refunds created on or after specified time will be retrieved.
Timestamp to filter returned records. Refunds created on or before specified time will be retrieved.
Transaction reference of the transaction for which the refund was processed.
The status of the refund.

executor_description: This API enables you process refund to a customer for a transaction.  Webhook Events and Request Structure are sent to merchants who have configured a webhook to receive notifications upon completion of a transaction refund.

queryParams.description: Unique identifier for the transaction generated by Monnify.
A note describing reason why this transaction is being refunded.
Amount to refund. Minimum value is N100, and maximum is total transaction amount. If not specified, total transaction amount will be refunded.
A note describing reason why this transaction is being refunded.
An optional note which will be serve as narration in credit to customer's bank account.
Status of the refund. Possible values are IN_PROGRESS, FAILED, COMPLETED.
FULL_REFUND or PARTIAL_REFUND. FULL_REFUND is refund amount is total transaction amount.
The data/time refund was initiated.
Date and time refund was completed to customer.
Comment describing status of the refund. If FAILED, comment will contain the reason for the failure.
Unique identifier for the transaction refund generated by the merchant. This value would be used to retrieve the details of a transaction refund.
Optional account number to send the refund amount to. Defaults to the customer account number on the transaction record.
Optional bank code for the destinationAccountNumber. This value would be used to identify the destination bank. Defaults to the customer bank code on the transaction record.

value.customerNote: A note to be sent to customer (limited to 16 characters)
value.destinationAccountNumber: Optional account number to send the refund amount to
value.destinationAccountBankCode: Optional bank code to identify the destination bank
